title: Ego Nwodim Tapped to Host Film Independent Spirit Awards
description:
Ego Nwodim, former â€œSaturday Night Liveâ€ cast member, will host the 41st annual Film Independent Spirit Awards.

	Nominations for the Spirit Awards
body:
Ego Nwodim, former â€œSaturday Night Liveâ€ cast member, will host the 41st annual Film Independent Spirit Awards.

	Nominations for the Spirit Awards were announced Dec. 3, with Ira Sachsâ€™ â€œPeter Hujarâ€™s Dayâ€ leading the film nominations. Netflixâ€™s â€œAdolescenceâ€ and BBCâ€™s â€œMr Lovermanâ€ topped the TV categories.

	Nwodim spent seven seasons on â€œSaturday Night Live,â€ earning two NAACP Image Award nominations. Her television credits include the second season of Peacockâ€™s â€œPoker Face,â€ HBOâ€™s â€œItâ€™s Florida, Manâ€ and Apple TV+â€™s anthology series â€œRoar.â€ Her film work includes Netflixâ€™s â€œPlayers,â€ IFCâ€™s â€œSpin Me Roundâ€ and Sonyâ€™s â€œLyle, Lyle, Crocodile.â€
	

	She also hosts the podcast â€œThanks Dad,â€ featuring guests including Randall Park, Kyle Mooney and Bill Burr. Upcoming projects include Huluâ€™s â€œNot Suitable for Work,â€ the feature adaptation â€œBackyard Baseballâ€ and Disney and Pixarâ€™s â€œHoppers.â€ This fall, Nwodim made her Off-Broadway debut at Lincoln Center with a one-woman comedy show as part of â€œThe Comedy Series.â€

	â€œNo stage celebrates the incredible work of these visionary artists and independent creators everywhere quite like the Spirit Awards,â€ Nwodim said in a statement. â€œI canâ€™t wait to join Film Independent for an afternoon of fun, laughs and a few surprises.â€

	â€œWe are thrilled to have the brilliantly talented Ego Nwodim joining us to host the 41st annual Spirit Awards,â€ said Brenda Robinson, acting president of Film Independent. â€œEgo has entertained audiences with her sharp wit and genius comedic timing for many years, and weâ€™re excited to make her a part of Film Independent history.â€
	

	Nwodim joins a long list of notable past Spirit Awards hosts, including Aidy Bryant, Hasan Minhaj, Megan Mullally and Nick Offerman, Aubrey Plaza, Nick Kroll and John Mulaney, Kate McKinnon and Kumail Nanjiani, Sarah Silverman, Queen Latifah and John Waters.

	Executive producer Shawn Davis will lead the ceremony, marking his 24th year with the Spirit Awards. Emmy-winning producers Eddie Delbridge of Live Digital Entertainment and Andrew Schaff will also return.

	The Spirit Awards serve as Film Independentâ€™s primary annual fundraiser, supporting year-round programs that champion emerging filmmakers and foster diversity and inclusion.

	Winners will be announced Feb. 15 at the Hollywood Palladium and streamed live on the Film Independent and IMDb YouTube channels beginning at 2 p.m. PT.

schema.headline: Ego Nwodim Tapped to Host Film Independent Spirit Awards

title: Fox Nation Teams With Zachary Levi for Docudrama â€˜David: King of Israelâ€™
description: Actor Zachary Levi will host â€œDavid: King of Israel,â€ a four part docudrama slated to debut on the Fox Nation streaming service in the first quarter
body:
Actor Zachary Levi will host â€œDavid: King of Israel,â€ a four part docudrama slated to debut on the Fox Nation streaming service in the first quarter of 2026, extending a growing library of content that tilts toward aficionados of faith and spirituality.

	The series will, in weekly installments, tell the story of David, who rose to become King of Israel, and who Christians regard as the ancestor of Jesus Christ. 


	â€œZacharyÂ LeviÂ was a natural fit for this series. His sincerity and connection to the material allow King Davidâ€™sÂ story to come alive in a way that feels relevant to todayâ€™s viewers,â€ said Lauren Petterson, president of Fox Nation, in a statement. â€œHighlighting faith, redemption, and extraordinary purpose, weâ€™re honored to bring this story to Fox Nation withÂ Zachary at the helm.â€Â Â 
	

	The series will chronicle Davidâ€™s life from young shepherd to ruler through reenactments, expert commentary and Leviâ€™s narration. 




	â€œAside from the account of Christ, the story of David is the most powerful in all of scripture. In fact, one might argue that itâ€™s even more powerful in some ways, given that David was fully human, and therefore flawed, like us, making his journey more relatable to our own,â€ Levi said in a statement. â€œItâ€™s a story Iâ€™ve wanted to be a part of telling ever since I was a child, so it was such a blessing being a part of this production.â€

	Fox Nation has in recent months worked to broaden its offering in faith-based content. The service also features two seasons of â€œThe Saints,â€ a documentary series backed by Martin Scorsese. Fox News Media recently said it had licensed a 52-episode â€œLife of Jesusâ€ podcast, a previously-created audio program that utilizes the voices of Kristen Bell, Sean Astin and Malcom McDowell, among others.
	

	Lev has appeared in the play â€œShe Loves Meâ€ and the Amazon streaming series â€œThe Marvelous Mrs. Maisel.â€ He is also known for starring in films based on the DC Comics character Shazam as well as the NBC series â€œChuck,â€ among other projects.

schema.headline: Fox Nation Teams With Zachary Levi for Docudrama â€˜David: King of Israelâ€™

title: Mavericks Frontman Raul Malo Dies at 60
description: Raul Malo, whose rich voice was the defining train of the Mavericks, the fittingly named group who brought Latin flavor and lively rock vibe to coun
body:
Raul Malo, whose rich voice was the defining train of the Mavericks, the fittingly named group who brought Latin flavor and lively rock vibe to country music in the 1990s, died on Monday, the band announced on social media. No cause of death was cited, but he announced back in June that he was battling Stage 4 colon cancer; he was 60.

	Malo co-wrote many of the bandâ€™s most popular songs, along with Rick Trevinoâ€™s 2003 hit â€œIn My Dreams,â€ and also worked as a solo performer and a member of the Los Super Seven supergroup. The Mavericks split in 1999 but reformed in 2015 and toured regularly. He released nine solo albums and a dozen studio efforts with the Mavericks, the most recent being 2024â€™s â€œMoon & Stars.â€
	

	â€œAnyone with the pleasure of being in Raulâ€™s orbit knew that he was a force of human nature, with an infectious energy,â€ the band wrote on Instagram. â€œOver a career of more than three decades entertaining millions around the globe, his towering creative contributions and unrivaled, generational talent created the kind of multicultural American music reaching far beyond America itself.â€



	While the entire band was a powerhouse, as lead singer Malo brought not only strong, soulful vocals that could veer between a Roy Orbison-esque baritone croon and country twang, but a genial humor that often manifested itself during the groupâ€™s concerts. The Mavericks earned their chops playing South Florida bars and frequently worked covers into their set; this writer can remember seeing them perform an impromptu version of â€œMoon Riverâ€ that was sung unforgettably by Malo.
	

	Born in Miami in 1965 to Cuban parents, Malo first united with the future Mavericks in 1989 as a rock band called the Basics. Malo initially was on bass and backing vocals, along with lead singer-guitarist Robert Reynolds, drummer Paul Deaking and lead guitarist Ben Peeler. Yet the bandâ€™s formula gelled when Malo and Reynolds switched places, with the former eventually becoming the primary songwriter and producer.

	The group released their self-titled debut album in 1990 and followed with â€œFrom Hell to Paradiseâ€ two years later. But they broke through with 1994â€™s â€œWhat a Crying Shame,â€ scoring hits with the title track and â€œThere Goes My Heart.â€ The bandâ€™s popularity rose through the â€˜90s, scoring a major country hit with â€œAll You Ever Do Is Bring Me Down,â€ featuring Tex-Mex star Flaco JimÃ©nez, and winning several CMA awards.

	Yet the band split in 1999 and Malo embarked on a solo career, releasing albums through 2023 that found him exploring multiple different genres, often backed by orchestration or singing in Spanish. The Maverickâ€™s reunited in 2011, signed with Big Machine Records and enjoyed a second successful run, touring regularly and releasing several albums for the label before going independent.

	Malo announced his illness in 2024 and, as noted by Rolling Stone, the group played the latest of their annual concerts at Nashvilleâ€™s Ryman Auditorium just a few days ago. â€œThe shows were celebratory, deeply emotional homages to Malo and his impact on music, featuring special guests like Rodney Crowell, Steve Earle, and Maggie Rose,â€ the publication wrote. â€œMalo, who received the American Eagle Award from the National Music Council of the United States, couldnâ€™t attend but sent an acceptance letter to be read.â€

	â€œMusic has been the guiding force of my entire life. It carried me from my Cuban American childhood in Miami to stages across the world. It introduced me to my brothers, the Mavericks. It gave me a home in Nashville, Tennessee. It allowed me to raise my three incredible sons, Dino, Vincent, and Max, who are my greatest pride and joy. And it connected me to you fans whose love has sustained me through every chapter of this journey,â€ it read.

	â€œIn these past months, Iâ€™ve had to fight battles Iâ€™ve never imagined,â€ his note concluded. â€œBut on the hardest of days, music remained my companion. Your letters, your stories of how a song helped you through loss, heartbreak, joy, those became our songs. You all carried me more than you knowâ€¦ Thank you for giving my voice a place to live, even when my body cannot be the one delivering it.â€

schema.headline: Mavericks Frontman Raul Malo Dies at 60

title: â€˜Jurassic World: Chaos Theoryâ€™ and â€˜Firebudsâ€™ Among Velma Award Winners for LGBTQ Representation in Kids and Family Programming (EXCLUSIVE)
description:
â€œJurassic World: Chaos Theory,â€ â€œFirebuds,â€ and â€œLetâ€™s Go Bananasâ€ are among the winners of this yearâ€™s Velma Awards.

	The second annual awards hon
body:
â€œJurassic World: Chaos Theory,â€ â€œFirebuds,â€ and â€œLetâ€™s Go Bananasâ€ are among the winners of this yearâ€™s Velma Awards.

	The second annual awards honor LGBTQ representation in kids and family programming.

	â€œJurassic World: Chaos Theoryâ€ takes home The Best Queer Break Up Thatâ€™s Just a Break Up Award; â€œFirebudsâ€ wins the The One Mom is Good But Two Moms Are Great Award; and â€œLetâ€™s Go Bananasâ€ wins The Show So Great and Inclusive We Wish It Would Adopt Us Award.
	

	Other winners are â€œThe Bravest Knight,â€ â€œJane,â€ â€œFionna & Cake,â€ â€œThe Fabulous Show with Fay and Fluffy,â€ and â€œBearbrick.â€ Longtime PBS executive Linda Simensky receives the Legacy Award for her work on â€œArthur.â€


	The Velmas are presented by The Rainbow Project, an organization founded in 2024 by Chris Nee, Kristi Reed and Jeremy Blacklow to further LGBTQ+ representation in childrenâ€™s media. The organization champions queer narratives in childrenâ€™s and family programming as well as behind-the-scenes artists, producers, writers and executives that advocate for LGBTQ+ inclusion in childrenâ€™s storytelling.

	The awards arrive at a time when queer media is in jeopardy, with the number of eligible honorees dropping nearly 40 percent from last year, Blacklow said: â€œThis year, celebrating these victories is not just important â€” itâ€™s urgent. These creators arenâ€™t simply making content. They are holding ground on behalf of a generation of queer youth.â€

	Nee added, â€œIt was always hard to get LGBTQ+ narratives approved, but now itâ€™s nearly impossible. None of these wins happened by accident â€” they are the result of someone advocating fiercely behind the scenes.â€ Meanwhile, Reed summed up the awardsâ€™ value by stating, â€œQueer visibility in childrenâ€™s media is not optional â€” itâ€™s essential. When young viewers see themselves and their families reflected authentically on screen, it affirms that they belong.â€
	

	See the full list of award categories and winners below.

	Best Queer Break Up, Thatâ€™s Just a Break Upâ€œJurassic World: Chaos Theoryâ€S2 E5 â€œBoiling Overâ€Netflix

	The One Mom Is Good But Two Moms Are Greatâ€œFirebudsâ€Â S2 E24 â€œA Family Traditionâ€Disney Junior / Disney+

	The Show So Great and Inclusive We Wish It Would Adopt Us Award â€œLetâ€™s Go Bananasâ€S1 E26 â€œReunion at the Orchardâ€CBC Kids / CBC Gem

	Respecting Pronouns & Gender Identity Is So Simple Even a Preschooler Can Understand It Awardâ€œThe Bravest Knightâ€S2B E 208 â€œThe Dragonâ€™s Towerâ€Hulu

	Most Adorkable Dads Who Say â€œI Love Youâ€ Awardâ€œJaneâ€S3 E3 â€œSay It Out Loudâ€Apple TV

	Most Fabulous Celebration of All the Shades of Queernessâ€œFionna & Cakeâ€The Entire ShowHBO Max

	The Preschool Teachers We All Wish We Had Awardâ€œThe Fabulous Show with Fay and Fluffyâ€The Entire ShowYouTube

	The â€œLetâ€™s Be Clear, I Have Two Momsâ€ Awardâ€œBearbrickâ€S1, Ep. 6Apple TV

	Legacy AwardLinda Simensky (â€œArthurâ€)PBS

schema.headline: â€˜Jurassic World: Chaos Theoryâ€™ and â€˜Firebudsâ€™ Among Velma Award Winners for LGBTQ Representation in Kids and Family Programming (EXCLUSIVE)

title: David Ellison Courted Warner Bros. Discoveryâ€™s Zaslav Hard Over 12 Weeks to Win a Deal. Then WBDâ€™s Chief Went Silent
description: David Ellison fought hard to win Warner Bros. Discovery. But despite his strenuous efforts, he lost out to Netflix â€” and now Ellison is switching fr
body:
David Ellison fought hard to win Warner Bros. Discovery. But despite his strenuous efforts, he lost out to Netflix â€” and now Ellison is switching from carrots to sticks: Paramount Skydance is taking its case directly to shareholders in a hostile takeover bid for WBD.

	New details disclosed in a Paramount SEC filing reveal the lengths Ellison went to try to clinch a pact with David Zaslav, president and CEO of Warner Bros. Discovery. Ellison courted Zaslav as hard as he could: He hosted Zaslav at a dinner with his father, Larry Ellison. David Ellison met with Zaslav at the latterâ€™s home in Beverly Hills to discuss a potential deal. And Larry Ellison met over a videoconference with Zaslav and John Malone, chairman emeritus of Warner Bros. and a major shareholder, to â€œdiscuss Paramountâ€™s interest in a combination with Warner Bros.,â€ per the filing. 
	

	David Ellison and his teams at Paramount Skydance, together with their outside legal and financial advisory firms, worked over Thanksgiving to put together a more compelling offer to buy all of WBD â€” ultimately extending an all-cash offer of $30/share, with an equity value of $77.9Â billion. Ellison even offered offered Zaslav a co-CEO and co-chairman role in a combined Paramount-Warner Bros. Discovery.

	But the board of WBD rejected every proposal Ellison put forward, and on Friday, Dec. 5, the company announced a deal with Netflix to sell Warner Bros. studios and HBO Max in a deal with an equity value of $72 billion.

	â€œParamount made six proposals over 12 weeks to the Warner Bros. Board,â€ culminating in the all-cash offer of $30 per share on Dec. 4, according to the Paramount Skydance filing outlining the parameters of its WBD takeover efforts and the background to the negotiations. â€œThe final proposal stated Paramount was ready to immediately sign the transaction, accompanied by fully executable agreements with fully committed debt financing and fully committed equity financing from the Ellison family. Despite these facts, the Warner Bros. Board and its advisors chose on that pivotal December 4th to make no effort to even speak with Paramount or its representatives about anything. Instead, the Warner Bros. Board, in possession of a $30 per share cash offer with a clearer and faster path to regulatory approval, committed Warner Bros. and its stockholders to an obviously financially inferior transactionâ€ â€” the Netflix agreement â€” â€œwith extraordinary regulatory risk and a longer timeline to a possible closing.â€
	

	Ellison, who felt the WBD board hadnâ€™t treated him fairly, wasnâ€™t done fighting to get his hands on the prize. On Monday, Paramount Skydance announced its intention to stage a hostile takeover bid for Warner Bros. Discovery. â€œWeâ€™re taking our offer directly to shareholders because they deserve transparency and the ability to make an informed decision,â€ Ellison told investors on a call. â€œOur proposal is superior to Netflixâ€™s in every dimension, higher headline value, increased certainty in that value, greater regulatory certainty and a pro-Hollywood, pro-consumer and pro competition future. Weâ€™re confident that once shareholders have the opportunity to choose for themselves, theyâ€™ll choose Paramount.â€

	On Dec. 4, following Paramountâ€™s submission of a $30/share offer to the WBD board, Ellison sent the following text to Zaslav:Â â€œJust tried calling you about new bid we have submitted. I heard you on all your concerns and believe we have addressed them in our new proposal. Please give me a call back when you can to discuss in detail.â€ 

	At approximately 4 p.m. ET on Dec. 4 â€” â€œhaving heard nothing all day,â€ per the Paramount filing â€” Ellison sent the following text to Zaslav: â€œDaivd [sic], I appreciate youâ€™re underwater today so I wanted to send you a quick text. Please note when you next meet as a board we wanted to offer you a package that addressed all of the issues you discussed we [sic] me. Those were 1 we wanted to offer complete certainty 2 strong cash value 3 speed to close. Please note importantly we did not include â€˜best and finalâ€™ in our bid. Also please know despite the noise of the last 24 hours I have nothing but respect and admiration for you and the company. It would be the honor of a lifetime to be your partner and to be the owner of these iconic assets. If we have the privilege to work together you will see that my father and I are the people you had dinner with. We are always loyal and honorable to our partners and hope we have the opportunity to prove that to you. Best, David.â€

	Neither Zaslav nor any representative of WBD responded, according to Paramount.

	At approximately 11 p.m. ET on Dec. 4, news outlets (including Variety) began reporting that Warner Bros. had entered into an exclusivity agreement with Netflix.
	

	As revealed in Paramountâ€™s SEC filing, Warner Bros. Discovery and Paramount spent a lot of time fighting over the terms of a confidentiality agreement that would require â€œno contact with the Warner Bros. Board or any other person at Warner Bros. other than Mr. Zaslav, a requirement to seek permission before Paramount could engage with any debt or equity financing sources and a broad waiver of claims and challenges against Warner Bros. and its representatives relating to Warner Bros.â€™ sale process.â€

	WBD and Paramount also tussled over foreign financing, reflecting Warner Bros. Discoveryâ€™s desire to steer the deal away from review by the Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States, the U.S. governmentâ€™s interagency body that reviews foreign investments in U.S. businesses potential national security risks.

	According to Paramountâ€™s deal terms to acquire WBD, the three Middle Eastern sovereign wealth funds (Saudi Arabia, Qatar and Abu Dhabi) and Jared Kushnerâ€™s Affinity Partners are backing the $30/share offer for Warner Bros. Discovery, along with Larry Ellison, RedBird Capital Partners. But the Arab wealth funds and Kushnerâ€™s Affinity â€œhave agreed to forgo any governance rights â€” including board representation â€” associated with their non-voting equity investments.â€ As such, the deal would not require CFIUS review, according to Paramount. In addition, Chinese internet company Tencent, which had previously committed $1 billion toward the WBD takeover deal, is no longer a financing partner.

	Meanwhile, before the Skydance-Paramount deal, Warner Bros. Discovery and Shari Redstoneâ€™s Paramount Global talked about combinations in 2023 and 2024. As Variety has previously reported, Zaslav had met with Paramountâ€™s then-CEO Bob Bakish in December 2023 toÂ explore a possible WBD-Paramount merger. WBD and Paramount execs continued discussions through April of 2024 and the companies engaged in â€œmutual due diligenceâ€ â€” but Warner Bros. Discovery never submitted a formal bid for Paramount Global. â€œNone of those discussions led to entry into any definitive agreement for a business combination,â€ the Paramount filing says.

schema.headline: David Ellison Courted Warner Bros. Discoveryâ€™s Zaslav Hard Over 12 Weeks to Win a Deal. Then WBDâ€™s Chief Went Silent

title: Sophia Bush Sets Road Trip Comedy at Roku Channel, Lauren Holly and Steve Guttenberg to Co-Star (EXCLUSIVE)
description: Sophia Bush is starring in and executive producing â€œBroad Trip,â€ a road trip comedy for The Roku Channel. Bush leads the film, which co-stars Lauren
body:
Sophia Bush is starring in and executive producing â€œBroad Trip,â€ a road trip comedy for The Roku Channel. Bush leads the film, which co-stars Lauren Holly and Steve Guttenberg, set to debut in May 2026.

	Per the official logline, â€œWhen buttoned-up daughter Alice (Bush) plans a â€œbacheloretteâ€ road trip with her wild and impulsive mother, Jeanie (Holly), to talk her out of marrying a guy she just met (Guttenberg), they rediscover their unbreakable bond, confronting old wounds and old flames, while learning the lesson that sometimes life doesnâ€™t follow a plan â€” and maybe thatâ€™s okay.â€
	

	â€œAs a kid who grew up watching classic 90s comedies and yearns for more, the moment I read this script, I said yes,â€ Bush says. â€œBeing able to play alongside Lauren and Steve made a hilarious story a dream come true. And doing something new with a streamer thatâ€™s both innovative and growing so quickly is thrilling to me as a producer, too. I canâ€™t wait for audiences to take a BROAD TRIP with us!â€




	

									Steve Wilkie
	



	Morgan Pichinson of Roku Originals adds, â€œAt Roku, our goal is to tell stories that reflect the humor, heart, and everyday moments our viewers connect with the most. Led by the amazing Sophia Bush and Lauren Holly, â€˜Broad Tripâ€™ captures that spirit perfectly with its hilarious and heartfelt take on family relationships.â€

	â€œBroad Tripâ€ will debut in May 2026. Chelsea Davison writes and executive produces with Yan-Kay Crystal directing. Joel S. Rice and Michael Barbuto produce for Muse Entertainment. Jonas Prupas, Aren Prupas and Meghan Mathes Jacobs also executive produce. Lisa Soper and Motion Content are consulting producers.

schema.headline: Sophia Bush Sets Road Trip Comedy at Roku Channel, Lauren Holly and Steve Guttenberg to Co-Star (EXCLUSIVE)

title: Telemundo Has Sold 90% of Ad Time Tied to 2026 FIFA World Cup Telecasts
description: NBCUniversal is almost cleared out of advertising inventory tied to coming telecasts of the 2026 FIFA World Cup on Telemundo â€” which remains more th
body:
NBCUniversal is almost cleared out of advertising inventory tied to coming telecasts of the 2026 FIFA World Cup on Telemundo â€” which remains more than half a year away from starting.

	Telemundo inventory tied to the tournament is 90%, the company revealed Tuesday. The Spanish-language network holds exclusive rights to telecast Spanish-language broadcasts of the event in the U.S. The company says it is seeing double the spend from advertisers when compared to the sales process behind the 2022 FIFA World Cup. Among the companies buying commercials are Anheuser-Busch, AT&T, Bank of America, The Coca Cola Company, Diageo, McDonaldâ€™s, Toyota, Volkswagen of America and Xfinity, a subsidiary of Comcast, NBCUâ€™s corporate parent.
	

	â€œThe growth of soccer in the United States coupled with the domestic nature of the 2026 FIFA World Cup and rising demand for both live sports and Spanish language content has proved to be the winning formula for our company, as NBCUniversal sits in its strongest position ever this far out from a FIFA World Cup tournament,â€ says Peter Lazarus, executive vice president of NBC Sports & Olympics, Advertising and Partnerships. â€œThe upcoming competition in Spanish-language on Telemundo and Peacock will captivate a highly engaged and passionate audience that our partners are eager to connect with, and we are excited to deliver both brands and fans a world-class experience this summer.â€


	Telemundo will broadcast all 104 matches live between June 11 and July 19, 2026. Of the games, 92 will air on Telemundo and 12 on Universo. Every match will also stream live on Peacock and the Telemundo app.
	

	â€œThe unprecedented demand for the World Cup 2026 underscores the undeniable power of Latino fans as an economic engine shaping the future of sports and culture in America,â€ said Monica Gil, chief administrative and marketing officer of NBCUniversal Telemundo Enterprises, in a statement. â€œAdvertisers recognize the opportunity this moment presents â€”  a once-in-a-lifetime tournament taking place across North America â€” to drive engagement, loyalty, and cultural relevance at scale. Telemundo is uniquely positioned to deliver on that opportunity, and the response from the marketplace reaffirms our ability to connect brands with fans through the power and excitement of live sports.â€

schema.headline: Telemundo Has Sold 90% of Ad Time Tied to 2026 FIFA World Cup Telecasts

title: Vijay Sethupathi, Nivin Pauly Lead JioHotstar Southern Slate as Leading Indian Streamer Reveals $445 Million Content Investment
description: Indian streaming giant JioHotstar has committed INR4,000 crore ($445 million) to South Indiaâ€™s creative economy over the next five years, the platfo
body:
Indian streaming giant JioHotstar has committed INR4,000 crore ($445 million) to South Indiaâ€™s creative economy over the next five years, the platform revealed at a star-studded event in Chennai attended by Tamil Nadu Deputy Chief Minister Udhayanidhi Stalin and South cinema luminaries including Kamal Haasan, Mohanlal and Nagarjuna.

	The investment announcement accompanied the unveiling of 25 new titles spanning originals, franchises and films, headlined by premium series â€œKaattaanâ€ starring Vijay Sethupathi and â€œPharmaâ€ featuring Nivin Pauly. The showcase also marked the signing of a letter of intent with the Government of Tamil Nadu to strengthen the stateâ€™s creative and production ecosystem.
	

	The commitment represents one of the largest streaming investments focused on regional Indian content, with 1,500 hours of fresh South programming slated to roll out over the next 12 months. The platform currently boasts 400 million users and serves audiences across 100% of Indiaâ€™s post codes, according to executives speaking at the event.


	â€œThe South has always been a creative powerhouse, and it is a privilege to serve a region that is defining the next era of Indian storytelling,â€ said Krishnan Kutty, head of entertainment (South) at JioStar. â€œIn just the last ten months, over 500 creators, directors and showrunners have joined us each bringing a voice that deserves to be heard across India and beyond.â€

	Addressing the cultural and economic impact of the partnership, Deputy Chief Minister Udhayanidhi Stalin emphasized the transformative potential for Tamil Naduâ€™s creative sector, noting the initiative will create 1,000 direct jobs and 15,000 indirect jobs. â€œThe contribution of South India has created a new benchmark for Indian cinema,â€ he stated. â€œToday, everyone has a voice â€” a filmmaker in Madurai or Salem can upload a story and reach an audience across the world.â€
	

	Member of Parliament and revered thespian Kamal Haasan, addressing the platformâ€™s reach, observed that the streaming landscape has fundamentally altered content distribution. â€œToday, stories are truly screen-agnostic. They travel with the viewer,â€ he said. â€œToday, regional is becoming the new national, and ethnic the new international. Stories born in Madurai, Malappuram, Mandya or Machilipatnam are no longer â€˜regional cinemaâ€™ â€” they are national cultural events.â€

	The announced slate includes returning franchises â€œKerala Crime Filesâ€ Season 3, â€œSave The Tigersâ€ Season 3, â€œHeartbeatâ€ Season 3 and â€œGood Wifeâ€ season 2, alongside new originals including â€œCousins And Kalyanams,â€ â€œMoodu Lantharlu,â€ â€œLBW â€“ Love Beyond Wicket,â€ â€œResort,â€ â€œSecret Stories: Roslin,â€ â€œLingamâ€ and â€œVikram On Duty.â€

	The platform is also producing â€œVishakha,â€ a regional adaptation of its acclaimed Hindi-language series â€œAarya,â€ and new films including â€œLucky The Superstarâ€ and â€œKenatha Kaanom.â€

	In unscripted programming, JioHotstar is expanding beyond its successful â€œBigg Bossâ€ â€“ the Indian adaptation of â€œBig Brotherâ€ â€“ franchise across the Tamil, Telugu, Malayalam and Kannada languages with new formats including â€œComedy Cooks,â€ â€œMad for Each Otherâ€ and â€œSecond Love.â€ Notably, â€œRoadiesâ€ will debut in Telugu, marking the first time the adventure format will be produced for South Indian audiences.

	According to platform metrics shared at the event, South entertainment has achieved 99.96% post code presence across India, with close to 45% of viewing occurring on connected TVs. Malayalam content particularly demonstrates cross-regional appeal, with over 80% of watch time driven by viewers outside Kerala.

	The platform reported that â€œHeartbeatâ€ generated over 100 million hours of watch time this year, while films â€œLokah Chapter 1: Chandraâ€ and â€œMiraiâ€ became its most-watched movies. Southern consumers spend nearly 70% more time on JioHotstar compared to the rest of India, executives noted.

	â€œJioHotstar started as a dream,â€ said Sushant Sreeram, head of SVOD business and chief marketing officer at JioStar. â€œThe resplendent story-telling heritage of South India and its sheer impact on Indiaâ€™s storytelling culture motivates us to keep championing rich, authentic and rooted narratives while delivering greater variety, accessibility and viewing experiences tailored to every viewerâ€™s tastes and dreams.â€
	

	The new slate features established stars including Aishwarya Rajesh, Kajal Aggarwal, Meena, Priyamani, Nayanthara, Samantha, Nithya Menen, Nandamuri Balakrishna, Aju Varghese and Lal, alongside emerging talent such as Deepa Balu, Anumol, Charukesh, Kavin, Arjun Radhakrishnan, Guru Lakshman and Smeha Manimegalai. The platformâ€™s broader content library also includes superstars Dhanush and Sivakarthikeyan among its talent roster.

	The ecosystem spans production houses including Banijay Group, Vikatan, DQ Productions, Aashirvad Cinemas, ARKA Media and Naavi Productions, with directors including Jeethu Joseph and Ahammed Khabeer.

	As part of its partnership with the Government of Tamil Nadu, JioHotstar will introduce creator-focused initiatives including writing labs, mentorship programs and skill-building workshops aimed at nurturing filmmakers, writers, editors and digital storytellers.

	JioHotstar was formed through the merger of JioCinema and Disney+ Hotstar, and currently maintains more than 300,000 hours of entertainment content across its library, serving audiences on 85 million connected TV devices nationwide.

schema.headline: Vijay Sethupathi, Nivin Pauly Lead JioHotstar Southern Slate as Leading Indian Streamer Reveals $445 Million Content Investment

title: â€˜Margoâ€™s Got Money Troublesâ€™: Elle Fanning, Michelle Pfeiffer, Nick Offerman Unveil First Look, Release Date of Apple TV Series
description:
The upcoming Apple TV series â€œMargoâ€™s Got Money Troublesâ€ has set its premiere date. 

	The series will debut with its first three episodes on April
body:
The upcoming Apple TV series â€œMargoâ€™s Got Money Troublesâ€ has set its premiere date. 

	The series will debut with its first three episodes on April 15, 2026, with new episodes dropping weekly thereafter through May 20. It is based on the Rufi Thorpe novel of the same name, with Elle Fanning starring as the titular. Apple has also released new first-look images of the series, which can be seen above and below. 


	Along with Fanning, the the cast includes Michelle Pfeiffer, Nick Offerman, Thaddea Graham, Nicole Kidman, Marcia Gay Harden, Greg Kinnear, Michael Angarano, Rico Nasty, and Lindsey Normington. 
	

	Per the official logline, the series follows â€œrecent college dropout and aspiring writer, Margo (Fanning), the daughter of an ex-Hooterâ€™s waitress (Pfeiffer) and ex-pro wrestler (Offerman), as sheâ€™s forced to make her way with a new baby, a mounting pile of bills and a dwindling amount of ways to pay them.â€ 

	David E. Kelley is adapting the book for the screen and also serves as executive producer and showrunner under his David E. Kelley Productions (DEKP) banner. Elle Fanning, Dakota Fanning, and Brittany Kahan Ward executive produce via Lewellen Pictures. Kidman and Per Saari executive produce for Blossom films along with Matthew Tinker for DEKP, Pfeiffer, Thorpe, Eva Anderson, and Boo Killebrew. Dearbhla Walsh directed the pilot and executive produces.  Kate Herron and Alice Seabright also direct. A24 is the studio. 



	

									Courtesy of Apple
	





	

									Courtesy of Apple
	





	

									Courtesy of Apple

schema.headline: â€˜Margoâ€™s Got Money Troublesâ€™: Elle Fanning, Michelle Pfeiffer, Nick Offerman Unveil First Look, Release Date of Apple TV Series

title: Google Faces EU Antitrust Probe Into Its Use of Online Content for AI Purposes
description: The EUâ€™s European Commission has launched an antitrust investigation into Googleâ€˜s use of online content to train its AI models and produce overview
body:
The EUâ€™s European Commission has launched an antitrust investigation into Googleâ€˜s use of online content to train its AI models and produce overviews. 

	The prove will determine whether GoogleÂ has breached EU competition rules byÂ using content from web publishers, including YouTube videos, for AI purposes; and will also examine whether Google is violating competition rules â€œby imposing unfair terms and conditions on publishers and content creatorsâ€, or â€œby granting itself privileged access to such content,â€ the European Commission said in its release. 
	

	In 2024., Europe passed a landmark AI Act which became the worldâ€™s first law aimed at regulating artificial intelligence technology. It has fueled existing tensions betweenÂ tech giants and EU regulators who have been clashing over a number of issues, such as antitrust and transparency, as well as the EUâ€™s security and privacy law, known as GDPR (General Data Protection Regulation). 


	â€œA free and democratic society depends on diverse media, open access to information, and a vibrant creative landscape,â€ said Teresa Ribera, exec VP for clean, just and competitive transition. â€œThese values are central to who we are as Europeans. AI is bringing remarkable innovation and many benefits for people and businesses across Europe, but this progress cannot come at the expense of the principles at the heart of our societies,â€ Ribera continued.

	The European Commission suggests Google may be harvesting content from web publishers to provide AI summaries or overviews and may be uploading video and other content on YouTube to train generative models. In both cases, the EU says Google may be breaching antitrust regulations by failing to  compensate publishers and give them the possibility to decline the use of their content. Google makes it mandatory for content creators uploading videos on YouTube to grant them permission to use their data. 
	

	Less than three months ago, Google wasÂ also fined nearly â‚¬3 billion for abusing its dominance in online advertising, prompting U.S. President Donald Trump to react. â€œThe European Union must stop this practice against American Companies,â€ Trump wrote on social media. The EU has already fined Google with â‚¬9.5 billion, while Apple was ordered to pay Ireland back taxes of â‚¬13 billion.

schema.headline: Google Faces EU Antitrust Probe Into Its Use of Online Content for AI Purposes

title: 'Family Matters' Star Darius McCrary Released From Custody Amid Legal Trouble
description:
'Family Matters' Darius McCrary
                          Released from Custody
body:
'Family Matters' Darius McCrary
                          Released from Custody
                      
                  
                        Published December 8, 2025 9:00 PM PST
                                                                      |
                Updated December 9, 2025 6:00 AM PST
                                    
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Darius McCrary is out of jail ... walking free from custody after a court hearing in front of a judge officially ending a messy stretch that started with a border arrest in Mexico ... TMZ has learned.
      
    
          The "Family Matters" star's public defender, Paulette Loftin, tells TMZ ... "Over the last four years, Mr. McCrary's fight for justice and truth has been painted as an attempt to shirk his responsibilities to his child. The resolution reached today makes it clear that family does matter and that it always has."
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          She adds, "This resolution allows Mr. McCrary to correct the misleading narrative and put this matter behind him."
      

          We broke the story ... McCrary was first busted in October near Tijuana and held on a no-bail order in San Diego. After several hearings, he was extradited to Michigan, where he faced five felony charges, including accusations of failing to pay child support and absconding.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          As part of Monday's deal, his rep, Ann Barlow, tells TMZ ... he entered a no-contest plea to all five felony charges. He's set to return to court for sentencing in February 2026.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          She adds he's relieved to be heading home for the holidays and still plans to continue fighting to clear his name.

schema.headline: 'Family Matters' Star Darius McCrary Released From Custody Amid Legal Trouble

title: Luigi Mangione Prosecutors Put Photos of Gun, Ammo Into Evidence
description:
Luigi Mangione
                          Gun Used To Whack Healthcare CEO?!?
body:
Luigi Mangione
                          Gun Used To Whack Healthcare CEO?!?
                      
                  
                        Published December 8, 2025 6:11 PM PST
                                                                      |
                Updated December 8, 2025 8:39 PM PST
                                    
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Prosecutors in the Luigi Mangione murder trial just entered a bunch of evidence into court ... including photos of the gun they say Luigi used to whack UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          The photos are included in new legal docs obtained by TMZ ... they show a handgun, bullets and a magazine. Cops say they found the gun and the loaded magazine in Luigi's bag when he was arrested.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          Police previously released photos of the gun last December around the time of Luigi's arrest ... but these are clearer photos from different angles ... in other words, it's the best look yet at the gun Luigi allegedly used to kill Thompson.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          Luigi's court hearing this month have been pretty juicy ... prosecutors resurfaced video from the shooting and released the 911 call that led to Luigi's arrest at a Pennsylvania McDonald's ... plus, we finally saw the body cam footage from the arrest.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          For his part, Luigi's pleaded not guilty to murdering Thompson, who was gunned down December 4, 2024 on a NYC sidewalk.

schema.headline: Luigi Mangione Prosecutors Put Photos of Gun, Ammo Into Evidence

title: Heidi Klum Tans Topless, on Video
description:
Heidi Klum
                          Sun's Out, Top's Off
                          ... Poolside
body:
Heidi Klum
                          Sun's Out, Top's Off
                          ... Poolside Tanning Session
                      
                  
                        Published December 9, 2025 7:58 AM PST
                                                                            
      
    
      
        
                    
                  
      
                    Instagram/@heidiklum
          
    
          Heidi Klum looked like an absolute sun goddess in a video posted Monday ... showing the model tanning topless by a pool.
      
    
          The "Project Runway" host blissfully indulged in one of her favorite pastimes, wearing just a bikini bottom in the 25-second clip. The post needs no words, because ... well, it speaks for itself.
      
    
      
        
                    
                  
      
                    Call Her Daddy / Spotify
          
    
          In a "Call Her Daddy" interview last year, Heidi came clean about her fondness for sunbathing, saying, "I love tanning. My dad was always like, 'Why are you doing this? How are you going to look when you're like 70?'"
      
    
          Don't worry, Dad! Right now, Heidi is 52 and she's still a total smoke show.
